decks.notes: This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells, backed up by disruptive cards like Duress and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck includes powerful cards such as Liliana of the Veil and Demonic Tutor to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The creatures in the deck, such as Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Headliner Scarlett, provide a steady stream of pressure while cards like Lightning Bolt and Terminate deal with any threats the opponent may present. With a mix of disruption, removal, and aggressive creatures, this deck looks to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and force the opponent on the defensive.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and control elements. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd serves as the commander, providing a powerful aggro option for quick victories. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Elite Spellbinder, Mother of Runes, and Palace Jailer, along with disruptive spells like Cataclysm, Path to Exile, and Swords to Plowshares. The deck also features powerful equipment such as Umezawa's Jitte and Shadowspear to enhance the creatures on the battlefield. With a solid mana base and card advantage through cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy for a decisive win.

This deck revolves around utilizing powerful control spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own win conditions. With a diverse range of removal spells, card draw effects, and versatile threats like Hidetsugu and Kairi, it aims to outvalue the opponent and control the pace of the game. The deck is designed to outmaneuver opponents through efficient card selection, resource denial, and strategic decision-making. By leveraging powerful control tools like Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Demonic Tutor, it can adapt to various situations and assert dominance on the battlefield. Its overall strategy is to establish board control, disrupt opposing strategies, and secure victory through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage in order to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. Aminatou, the Fateshifter's ability to manipulate the top of the deck allows for strategic plays and synergies with cards like Brainstorm, Enlightened Tutor, and Mystic Sanctuary. The deck includes a variety of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Fatal Push, along with powerful creatures like Baleful Strix and True-Name Nemesis for stabilizing the board. Additionally, the inclusion of critical card draw spells and tutors like Demonic Tutor and Teferi, Time Raveler ensures the deck has access to its key pieces consistently throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. The commander, Hidetsugu and Kairi, offer a unique playstyle that allows for versatile gameplay options. The deck includes a wide range of control spells such as Cryptic Command and Force of Will to counter threats, along with removal spells like Damnation and Fatal Push to deal with opposing creatures. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage to maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition such as Expropriate or Sorin's Vengeance.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. With Fury','','');">Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury as the commander, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Adeline, Resplendent Cathar and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Pyroblast. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Council's Judgment and Ranger-Captain of Eos to control the battlefield and protect its key threats. By applying pressure early and efficiently managing resources, the deck aims to defeat the opponent before they can stabilize and mount a comeback.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and flexibility, utilizing the Partner commanders Bruse Tarl and Thrasios in conjunction with a wide array of efficient creatures and powerful spells. The focus is on quickly establishing a strong board presence, while also having access to various forms of removal and protection to outmaneuver and overpower opponents. The deck's composition reflects a balance between speed and resilience, with an emphasis on utilizing the Partner mechanic to its fullest potential. By combining the strengths of each color in WURG, this deck is able to adapt to different situations and opponents, ensuring a dynamic and challenging gameplay experience.
